In order to put new knowledge into practice and gain my financial independence, I work under multiple positions as a part-time engineer, trying to discover as much to the researchðŸ”¬ sector as the industryðŸ’¼ one .

    Feb 2021

    Development of a distributed data-pipeline aiming at synchronizing multiple AI and neuroscience experiments.

  • ðŸ”¬Research Developer, Topology and Neuroscience Laboratory

    Jan 2021

    Topological Data Analysis for Covid19 tracing data of Geneva canton. We perform a network analysis on time-series of graphs to observe if the increase in number of Covid cases might be explained by changes in the topological structure of these graphs.

  • ðŸ’¼Machine Learning Consultant, Junior Entreprise

    Feb 2021

    Development of an object detection pipeline for industrial application

  • ðŸ’¼Machine Learning Engineer,Visium

    Jun 2020- Dec 2020

    In order to gain practical experience in industry, I decided to perform an internship in an ML consulting company. During this time, I improved solutions for 3 client projects (major Swiss companies) in Natural Language processing and Time Series forecasting. I also built the building blocks of a backend software and prepared deliverables for the DevOps. After excellent client feedbacks, I got offered to keep on working at Visium as a part-time ML engineer in parallel to my studies. The topics I worked on involve NLP, object detection and information retrieval.

  • ðŸ”¬Software Development Intern, Deplancke's Lab

    2017-2018

    I worked on the development of a multithreaded C++ real-time image analysis software facilitating a deterministic cell-bead coencapsulation allowing subsequent single cell sequencing. Thanks to encouraging results, I got hired as a research assistant in the same laboratory to pursue my research on the same topic.
